equal to the Investment Amount plus a specific annual rate of return less payments previously received by Investors. In the event of a change of control, we are obligated to pay Investors an amount equal to the Hard Cap in effect at the time, ranging from <ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_pure_NYrTOzSKjkSim0GndK59aw" contextRef="Duration_6_16_2022_To_6_16_2022_srt_RangeAxis_srt_MinimumMember_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_rytm_RevenueInterestFinancingAgreementMember_S6SLdvXReUuGXS1WPcoBQw" decimals="2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="rytm:RevenueInterestsPayableCapAsPercentOfInvestmentAmount" scale="-2" id="Narr_uB4AH-UkvEueQq2hBYuNqA">185</ix:nonFraction>% to <ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_pure_NYrTOzSKjkSim0GndK59aw" contextRef="Duration_6_16_2022_To_6_16_2022_srt_RangeAxis_srt_MaximumMember_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_rytm_RevenueInterestFinancingAgreementMember_56279slpR02Jx4MKaRTzfg" decimals="2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="rytm:RevenueInterestsPayableCapAsPercentOfInvestmentAmount" scale="-2" id="Narr_ip_3wZM0uk-mworRr-gAdQ">250</ix:nonFraction>% plus any Under Performance Payment of the Investment Amount less payments previously received by Investors. In addition, upon the occurrence of an event of default, including, among others, our failure to pay any amounts due to Investors under the deferred royalty obligation, insolvency, our failure to pay indebtedness when due, the revocation of regulatory approval of IMCIVREE in the U.S. or our breach of any covenant contained in the RIFA and our failure to cure the breach within the prescribed time frame, we are obligated to pay Investors an amount equal to the Hard Cap in effect at the time of default ranging from <ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_pure_NYrTOzSKjkSim0GndK59aw" contextRef="Duration_6_16_2022_To_6_16_2022_srt_RangeAxis_srt_MinimumMember_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_rytm_RevenueInterestFinancingAgreementMember_S6SLdvXReUuGXS1WPcoBQw" decimals="2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="rytm:RevenueInterestsPayableCapAsPercentOfInvestmentAmount" scale="-2" id="Narr_hkhvDzNb_0OPLbus2xdmqg">185</ix:nonFraction>% to <ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_pure_NYrTOzSKjkSim0GndK59aw" contextRef="Duration_6_16_2022_To_6_16_2022_srt_RangeAxis_srt_MaximumMember_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_rytm_RevenueInterestFinancingAgreementMember_56279slpR02Jx4MKaRTzfg" decimals="2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="rytm:RevenueInterestsPayableCapAsPercentOfInvestmentAmount" scale="-2" id="Narr_i_wHaS7-ikCV3K9QQgKq5Q">250</ix:nonFraction>% plus any Under Performance Payment of the Investment Amount less payments previously received by Investors. In addition, upon an event of default, Investors may exercise all other rights and remedies available under the RIFA, including foreclosing on the collateral that was pledged to Investors, which consists of all of our present and future assets relating to IMCIVREE.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12pt 0pt;">We have evaluated the terms of the RIFA and concluded that the features are similar to those of a debt instrument. Accordingly, we have accounted for the transaction as long-term debt and presented it as a deferred royalty obligation on our consolidated balance sheets. We have further evaluated the terms of the RIFA and determined that the repayment of the Hard Cap in effect at the time which ranges from <ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_pure_NYrTOzSKjkSim0GndK59aw" contextRef="Duration_6_16_2022_To_6_16_2022_srt_RangeAxis_srt_MinimumMember_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_rytm_RevenueInterestFinancingAgreementMember_S6SLdvXReUuGXS1WPcoBQw" decimals="2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="rytm:RevenueInterestsPayableCapAsPercentOfInvestmentAmount" scale="-2" id="Narr_nKgtxi5ovE2HE_WEx6R6Zg">185</ix:nonFraction>% to <ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_pure_NYrTOzSKjkSim0GndK59aw" contextRef="Duration_6_16_2022_To_6_16_2022_srt_RangeAxis_srt_MaximumMember_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_rytm_RevenueInterestFinancingAgreementMember_56279slpR02Jx4MKaRTzfg" decimals="2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="rytm:RevenueInterestsPayableCapAsPercentOfInvestmentAmount" scale="-2" id="Narr_vZdOTWaYsEio_X1Z6Zj8Qw">250</ix:nonFraction>% of the Investment Amount, less any payments made to date, upon a change of control is an embedded derivative that requires bifurcation from the debt instrument and fair value recognition. We determined the fair value of the derivative using an option pricing Monte Carlo simulation model taking into account the probability of change of control occurring and potential repayment amounts and timing of such payments that would result under various scenarios, as further described in Note 5, &#8220;Fair Value of Financial Instruments&#8221; to our consolidated financial statements. During the second quarter of 2022, the Company recorded $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_USD_ahrPfpXSU0iVPcR9ppfKnA" contextRef="As_Of_6_30_2022_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_rytm_RevenueInterestFinancingAgreementMember_s8ymDirz2E6Kzq2xgwgoxg" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="us-gaap:EmbeddedDerivativeFairValueOfEmbeddedDerivativeLiability" scale="3" id="Narr_oqtVvvfYREuKd0Za_GKZmg">1,590</ix:nonFraction> for the initial fair value of the embedded derivative liability. &#160;The fair value of the embedded derivative liability was $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_USD_ahrPfpXSU0iVPcR9ppfKnA" contextRef="As_Of_12_31_2023_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_rytm_RevenueInterestFinancingAgreementMember_jpN74e-Xu0-OuHEkg-QXVw" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="us-gaap:EmbeddedDerivativeFairValueOfEmbeddedDerivativeLiability" scale="3" id="Narr_GUXFkOzlo0yh5PoSfa2_sA">1,150</ix:nonFraction> and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_USD_ahrPfpXSU0iVPcR9ppfKnA" contextRef="As_Of_12_31_2022_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_rytm_RevenueInterestFinancingAgreementMember_DI0bKHWPg0i7apwd3rz1bg" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="us-gaap:EmbeddedDerivativeFairValueOfEmbeddedDerivativeLiability" scale="3" id="Narr_k4NNr_BXh0O5Ev0zZFt-5Q">1,340</ix:nonFraction> &#160; &#160;as of December 31, 2023 and December 31, 2022, respectively. We will remeasure the embedded derivative to fair value each reporting period until the time the features lapse and/or termination of the deferred royalty obligation. For the years ended December 31, 2023 and December 31, 2022, we recognized other income in the amount of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_USD_ahrPfpXSU0iVPcR9ppfKnA" contextRef="Duration_1_1_2023_To_12_31_2023_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_rytm_RevenueInterestFinancingAgreementMember_GE3KJiMPd0a23hQ3EpD7Dg" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="us-gaap:EmbeddedDerivativeGainLossOnEmbeddedDerivativeNet" sign="-" scale="3" id="Narr_5n-PWuk_rk2coaQQlVSTGg">190</ix:nonFraction> and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_USD_ahrPfpXSU0iVPcR9ppfKnA" contextRef="Duration_1_1_2022_To_12_31_2022_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_rytm_RevenueInterestFinancingAgreementMember_5zeLTWM1E0S3SGJNnmj_gQ" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="us-gaap:EmbeddedDerivativeGainLossOnEmbeddedDerivativeNet" sign="-" scale="3" id="Narr_gPgI-KECBkyZYGekFZhA5g">250</ix:nonFraction>, due to the remeasurement of the embedded derivative liability. The carrying value of the deferred royalty obligation at December 31, 2023 was $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_USD_ahrPfpXSU0iVPcR9ppfKnA" contextRef="As_Of_12_31_2023_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_rytm_RevenueInterestFinancingAgreementMember_jpN74e-Xu0-OuHEkg-QXVw" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="us-gaap:DeferredRevenueNoncurrent" scale="3" id="Narr_hioFPSRytEmsotQjvW_FQQ">106,143</ix:nonFraction> based on $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_USD_ahrPfpXSU0iVPcR9ppfKnA" contextRef="Duration_1_1_2023_To_12_31_2023_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_rytm_RevenueInterestFinancingAgreementMember_GE3KJiMPd0a23hQ3EpD7Dg" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="rytm:ProceedsFromRoyaltyFinancingAgreement" scale="3" id="Narr_hJ1i7tlrzkCa9Kmk-aEppg">100,000</ix:nonFraction> of proceeds, net of the initial fair value of the bifurcated embedded derivative liability upon execution of the RIFA, and debt issuance costs incurred. The carrying value of the deferred royalty obligation approximated fair value at December 31, 2023. The effective interest rate as of December 31, 2023 was <ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_pure_NYrTOzSKjkSim0GndK59aw" contextRef="As_Of_12_31_2023_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_rytm_RevenueInterestFinancingAgreementMember_jpN74e-Xu0-OuHEkg-QXVw" decimals="4" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentInterestRateEffectivePercentage" scale="-2" id="Narr_0Gt0AgXe-EWzCDr_9wxeWg">15.12</ix:nonFraction>%. In connection with the deferred royalty obligation, we incurred debt issuance costs totaling $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_USD_ahrPfpXSU0iVPcR9ppfKnA" contextRef="As_Of_12_31_2023_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_rytm_RevenueInterestFinancingAgreementMember_jpN74e-Xu0-OuHEkg-QXVw" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="us-gaap:DeferredFinanceCostsNet" scale="3" id="Narr_pDxZYNtNS0aUfdFXSfVDRw">3,287</ix:nonFraction>. Debt issuance costs have been netted against the debt and are being amortized over the estimated term of the debt using the effective interest method, adjusted on a prospective basis for changes in the underlying assumptions and inputs. The assumptions used in determining the expected repayment term of the debt and amortization period of the issuance costs requires that we make estimates that could impact the classification of these costs, as well as the period over which these costs will be amortized.</p></ix:continuation><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="Duration_1_1_2023_To_12_31_2023_L4NrFxv-B0-iufGoINNOeQ" name="us-gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock" id="Tb_7uc4M6WUYEat4R2l3KXx0A" continuedAt="Tb_7uc4M6WUYEat4R2l3KXx0A_cont1" escape="true"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;padding-bottom:12pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">12. Commitments and Contingencies</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;text-align:justify;background:#ffffff;margin:0pt;"><span style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Legal Proceedings</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;background:#ffffff;margin:0pt;">The Company, from time to time, may be party to various litigation arising in the ordinary course of business. The Company is not presently subject to any pending or threatened litigation that it believes, if determined adversely to </p></ix:nonNumeric></div><div style="clear:both;margin-bottom:30pt;width:100%;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;text-align:center;margin:24pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;">F-31</p></div></div>
<div style="background-color:#000000;clear:both;height:2pt;page-break-after:always;width:79.3%;border:0;margin:30pt 10.35% 30pt 10.35%;"></div><div style="max-width:100%;padding-left:10.35%;padding-right:10.35%;position:relative;"><div style="margin-top:21.6pt;min-height:41.75pt;width:100%;"><p style="font-family:'Times New material adverse effect on its business or financial results.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;text-align:justify;background:#ffffff;margin:0pt;"><span style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Other</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;background:#ffffff;margin:0pt;">The Company is party to various agreements, principally relating to licensed technology, that require future payments relating to milestones that may be met in subsequent periods, or royalties on future sales of specified products. &#160;See Note&#160;10 for discussion of these arrangements. &#160;Additionally, the Company is party to various contracts with CROs and CMOs that generally provide for termination on notice, with the exact amounts in the event of termination to be based on the timing of the termination and the terms of the agreement.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;background:#ffffff;margin:0pt;">Based &#160;on &#160;the Company&#8217;s &#160;current &#160;development &#160;plans as of December 31, 2023, the Company does not expect to make milestone payments due to third parties during &#160;the &#160;next &#160;12 &#160;months &#160;from &#160;the &#160;filing &#160;of &#160;this &#160;Annual &#160;Report on &#160;Form 10-K, in connection with our license agreements. These milestones generally become &#160;due &#160;and &#160;payable &#160;upon achievement of such milestones or sales and achievement of development milestones. &#160;When the &#160;achievement &#160;of &#160;these &#160;milestones or sales have not occurred, such contingencies are not recorded in the Company&#8217;s consolidated financial statements. &#160;</p></ix:continuation><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="Duration_1_1_2023_To_12_31_2023_L4NrFxv-B0-iufGoINNOeQ" name="us-gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock" id="Tb_poSzWCmQLUqvHyJcUcV49w" escape="true"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;text-align:justify;margin:0pt 0pt 12pt 0pt;">13. Related-Party Transactions</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;margin:0pt;">Amounts paid directly to consultants and vendors considered to be related parties amounted to $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_USD_ahrPfpXSU0iVPcR9ppfKnA" contextRef="Duration_1_1_2023_To_12_31_2023_srt_CounterpartyNameAxis_rytm_ConsultantsAndVendorsMember_hwyW0qRnlEavJYbEQhehyA" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="us-gaap:AffiliateCosts" scale="3" id="Narr_fAZwezfeV0KcI6YnYXaSJg">1,141</ix:nonFraction>, $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_USD_ahrPfpXSU0iVPcR9ppfKnA" contextRef="Duration_1_1_2022_To_12_31_2022_srt_CounterpartyNameAxis_rytm_ConsultantsAndVendorsMember_wTz-A8vweUGv1sHJQQlQmg" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="us-gaap:AffiliateCosts" scale="3" id="Narr_TZXajyvK-k65ZEo_hORg2w">1,868</ix:nonFraction>, and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_USD_ahrPfpXSU0iVPcR9ppfKnA" contextRef="Duration_1_1_2021_To_12_31_2021_srt_CounterpartyNameAxis_rytm_ConsultantsAndVendorsMember_aTcsm1ZBxEmL5PPawbR01w" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="us-gaap:AffiliateCosts" scale="3" id="Narr_YXLXPOxzP0aGZTH1t890RQ">1,961</ix:nonFraction> for the&#160;years ended December&#160;31, 2023, 2022 and 2021, respectively. Outstanding payments due to these related parties as of December&#160;31, 2023 and 2022 were $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_USD_ahrPfpXSU0iVPcR9ppfKnA" balance sheets.</p></ix:nonNumeric><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><a id="_Hlk160054937"></a><a Income Taxes</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;text-indent:36pt;margin:0pt;">The components of loss before income taxes are as follows:</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><table style="border-collapse:collapse;font-size:16pt;height:max-content;padding-left:0pt;padding-right:0pt;width:100%;"><tr style="height:1pt;"><td style="vertical-align:bottom;width:65.26%;margin:0pt;padding:0pt;"><div style="height:1pt;overflow:hidden;overflow-wrap:break-word;position:relative;"><div style="bottom:0pt;position:absolute;width:100%;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12pt 0pt;">ASC 740 requires a valuation allowance to reduce the deferred tax assets reported if, based on the weight of available evidence, it is more likely than not that some portion or all of the deferred tax assets will not be realized. After consideration of all the evidence, both positive and negative, the Company has recorded a full valuation allowance against its deferred tax assets at December&#160;31, 2023 and 2022, because the Company's management has determined that is it more likely than not that these assets will not be realized. The increase in the valuation allowance of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_USD_ahrPfpXSU0iVPcR9ppfKnA" contextRef="Duration_1_1_2023_To_12_31_2023_L4NrFxv-B0-iufGoINNOeQ" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="us-gaap:ValuationAllowanceDeferredTaxAssetChangeInAmount" scale="3" id="Narr_TFsBiPdIh0mEeaW8NERfLQ">49,901</ix:nonFraction> in 2023 and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_USD_ahrPfpXSU0iVPcR9ppfKnA" contextRef="Duration_1_1_2022_To_12_31_2022_fEIi_NiajUu4-yl1Dx2pvQ" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="us-gaap:ValuationAllowanceDeferredTaxAssetChangeInAmount" scale="3" id="Narr_1mGzDp3OPk2SKMzolp1AGw">59,046</ix:nonFraction> in 2022 primarily relates to the net loss incurred by the Company during each period.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12pt 0pt;">As of December&#160;31, 2023, the Company had federal and state net operating loss carryforwards of approximately $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_USD_ahrPfpXSU0iVPcR9ppfKnA" contextRef="As_Of_12_31_2023_GO4PpmA6DEm4v3ZiQ2HMYA" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="us-gaap:DeferredTaxAssetsOperatingLossCarryforwardsDomestic" scale="3" id="Narr_T5-jkciE806I9JSitrnPWg">555,563</ix:nonFraction> and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_USD_ahrPfpXSU0iVPcR9ppfKnA" contextRef="As_Of_12_31_2023_GO4PpmA6DEm4v3ZiQ2HMYA" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="us-gaap:DeferredTaxAssetsOperatingLossCarryforwardsStateAndLocal" scale="3" id="Narr_MEwszvtd4EeWYAbrEdev7Q">597,952</ix:nonFraction>, respectively, which are available to reduce future taxable income. The net operating loss carryforwards expire at various times beginning in 2033 for federal and state purposes. &#160;Of the federal net operating loss carryforwards at December 31, 2023, $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_USD_ahrPfpXSU0iVPcR9ppfKnA" contextRef="As_Of_12_31_2023_GO4PpmA6DEm4v3ZiQ2HMYA" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" Additionally, as of 2023, the Company had a federal orphan drug credit related to qualifying research of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_USD_ahrPfpXSU0iVPcR9ppfKnA" contextRef="As_Of_12_31_2023_GO4PpmA6DEm4v3ZiQ2HMYA" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="rytm:DeferredTaxAssetsTaxCreditCarryForwardsFederalOrphanDrugQualifyingResearch" scale="3" id="Narr_HaZu8dayREyYsMv4WIF15w">25,484</ix:nonFraction>. These tax credit carryforwards will begin to expire at various times beginning in 2033 for federal purposes and 2028 for state purposes.</p></ix:continuation></div><div style="clear:both;margin-bottom:30pt;width:100%;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;text-align:center;margin:24pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;">F-33</p></div></div>
<div style="background-color:#000000;clear:both;height:2pt;page-break-after:always;width:79.3%;border:0;margin:30pt 10.35% 30pt 10.35%;"></div><div style="max-width:100%;padding-left:10.35%;padding-right:10.35%;position:relative;"><div style="margin-top:21.6pt;min-height:41.75pt;width:100%;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 0pt 30pt 0pt;"><a href="#TOC"><span style="font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">Table of Contents</span></a></p></div><div style="clear:both;max-width:100%;position:relative;"><ix:continuation id="Tb_2l6z-37gwEi2JpkoPwnXTA_cont2"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12pt 0pt;">The net operating loss and tax credit carryforwards are subject to review and possible adjustment by the Internal Revenue Service and state tax authorities. Net operating loss and tax credit carryforwards may become subject to an annual limitation in the event of certain cumulative changes in the ownership interest of significant stockholders over a three-year period in excess of 50%, as defined under Sections&#160;382 and 383 of the Internal Revenue Code, respectively, as well as similar state provisions and other provisions within the Internal Revenue Code. This could limit the amount of tax attributes that can be utilized annually to offset future taxable income or tax liabilities. The amount of the annual limitation is determined based on the value of the Company immediately prior to the ownership change. Subsequent ownership changes may further affect the limitation in future&#160;years. &#160; &#160;</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12pt 0pt;">The Company has not provided U.S. deferred income taxes or foreign withholding taxes on unremitted earnings of foreign subsidiaries of approximately $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_USD_ahrPfpXSU0iVPcR9ppfKnA" contextRef="As_Of_12_31_2023_GO4PpmA6DEm4v3ZiQ2HMYA" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="rytm:UnremittedEarningsForeignSubsidiares" scale="3" id="Narr_FegvmOAt_ESJ-4T8z4u20A">730</ix:nonFraction> as such amounts are considered to be indefinitely reinvested in these jurisdictions. The accumulated earnings in the foreign subsidiaries are primarily utilized to fund working capital requirements as its subsidiaries continue to expand their operations and to fund future foreign acquisitions. The amount of any unrecognized deferred tax liability related to undistributed foreign earnings is immaterial.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12pt 0pt;">The Company has not recorded any reserves for uncertain tax positions as of December 31, 2023 and 2022. The Company has not, as yet, conducted a study of research and development credit carryforwards. This study may result in an adjustment to the Company's research and development credit carryforwards; however, until a study is completed and any adjustment is known, no amounts are being presented as an uncertain tax position. A full valuation allowance has been provided against the Company's research and development credits and, if an adjustment is required, this adjustment would be offset by an adjustment to the valuation allowance. Thus, there would be no impact to the balance sheets or statements of operations and comprehensive loss if an adjustment were required. &#160;</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12pt 0pt;">Interest and penalty charges, if any, related to unrecognized tax benefits will be classified as provision for income taxes in the accompanying statements of operations and comprehensive loss. As of December 31, 2023 and 2022, the Company had <ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_USD_ahrPfpXSU0iVPcR9ppfKnA" contextRef="As_Of_12_31_2022_42FeI8I8zUKH9s1lk5xb1A" decimals="-3" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen" name="us-gaap:IncomeTaxExaminationPenaltiesAndInterestAccrued" scale="3" id="Narr_Bo2WPMl9ykSx-Ea5fCa4fg"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_USD_ahrPfpXSU0iVPcR9ppfKnA" contextRef="As_Of_12_31_2023_GO4PpmA6DEm4v3ZiQ2HMYA" decimals="-3" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen" name="us-gaap:IncomeTaxExaminationPenaltiesAndInterestAccrued" scale="3" id="Narr_VHtxj2u6fUuBMZrlgnnlVQ">no</ix:nonFraction></ix:nonFraction> accrued interest or penalties related to uncertain tax positions.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12pt 0pt;">The Company is subject to examination by the U.S. federal, state and local income tax authorities for tax&#160;years 2013 forward. The Company is not currently under examination by the Internal Revenue Service or any other jurisdictions for any tax&#160;years.</p></ix:continuation><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="Duration_1_1_2023_To_12_31_2023_L4NrFxv-B0-iufGoINNOeQ" name="us-gaap:DefinedContributionPlanTextBlock" id="Tb_NcfqZx5S1EWTeW5ZQMAmIA" escape="true"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt 0pt 12pt 0pt;"><b style="font-weight:bold;">15. Retirement Plan</b></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12pt 0pt;">The Company has a 401(k) defined contribution plan for the benefit for all US employees and permits voluntary contributions by employees subject to IRS-imposed limitations. Beginning in 2021, the Company matched <ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_pure_NYrTOzSKjkSim0GndK59aw" contextRef="Duration_1_1_2023_To_12_31_2023_L4NrFxv-B0-iufGoINNOeQ" decimals="2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="us-gaap:DefinedContributionPlanEmployerMatchingContributionPercentOfMatch" scale="-2" id="Narr_qKWflrVvCkKqcq7gneTsQg">100</ix:nonFraction>% of eligible employee contributions on the first <ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_pure_NYrTOzSKjkSim0GndK59aw" contextRef="Duration_1_1_2023_To_12_31_2023_L4NrFxv-B0-iufGoINNOeQ" decimals="2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="us-gaap:DefinedContributionPlanEmployerMatchingContributionPercent" scale="-2" id="Narr_t5yzS1PgH0eDTIHqH3Ql5Q">4</ix:nonFraction>% of employee salary (up to the IRS maximum).&#160; Contributions for the years ended December 31, 2023, 2022 and 2021 were $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_USD_ahrPfpXSU0iVPcR9ppfKnA" contextRef="Duration_1_1_2023_To_12_31_2023_L4NrFxv-B0-iufGoINNOeQ" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="us-gaap:DefinedContributionPlanEmployerDiscretionaryContributionAmount" scale="3" id="Narr_HboQV5Q1GUG-bkElTxUN4w">1,460</ix:nonFraction>, $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_USD_ahrPfpXSU0iVPcR9ppfKnA" contextRef="Duration_1_1_2022_To_12_31_2022_fEIi_NiajUu4-yl1Dx2pvQ" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="us-gaap:DefinedContributionPlanEmployerDiscretionaryContributionAmount" scale="3" id="Narr_bZOH_UzBK0izngnla0TDTQ">1,195</ix:nonFraction> and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_USD_ahrPfpXSU0iVPcR9ppfKnA" contextRef="Duration_1_1_2021_To_12_31_2021_S1u8A86A9UC-gG8GbtSGPw" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="us-gaap:DefinedContributionPlanEmployerDiscretionaryContributionAmount" scale="3" id="Narr_nWyGu1NUpUeJOHKd9V4ogg">886</ix:nonFraction>, respectively.</p></ix:nonNumeric><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="Duration_1_1_2023_To_12_31_2023_L4NrFxv-B0-iufGoINNOeQ" name="us-gaap:SegmentReportingDisclosureTextBlock" id="Tb_n5GZmdA2NkOiHhJlfYnf_A" continuedAt="Tb_n5GZmdA2NkOiHhJlfYnf_A_cont1" escape="true"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt 0pt 12pt 0pt;"><b style="font-weight:bold;">16. &#160;Segment and Geographic Information</b></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12pt 0pt;">Disclosure requirements about segments of an enterprise and related information establishes standards for reporting information regarding operating segments in annual financial statements and requires selected information of those segments to be presented in interim financial reports issued to shareholders. Operating segments are defined as components of an enterprise about which separate discrete financial information is available that is evaluated regularly by the chief operating decision maker, or decision-making group, in deciding how to allocate resources and in assessing performance. The Company&#8217;s chief operating decision maker is the chief executive officer. The Company and the chief executive officer view the Company&#8217;s operations and manage its business as <ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_segment_Ji5yhYytXke2i4QjL74TRA" contextRef="Duration_1_1_2023_To_12_31_2023_L4NrFxv-B0-iufGoINNOeQ" decimals="INF" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen" name="us-gaap:NumberOfOperatingSegments" scale="0" id="Narr_Q_dLZpPaOEq_DIsjPoxpDQ">one</ix:nonFraction> operating segment.</p></ix:nonNumeric></div><div style="clear:both;margin-bottom:30pt;width:100%;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;text-align:center;margin:24pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;">F-34</p></div></div>
<div style="background-color:#000000;clear:both;height:2pt;page-break-after:always;width:79.3%;border:0;margin:30pt 10.35% 30pt 10.35%;"></div><div id="Tb_dZOCyq5Sk0-jbZHf1l5gpA" escape="true"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt 0pt 12pt 0pt;"><b style="font-weight:bold;">17. Subsequent Events</b></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;margin:0pt;">The Company considers events or transactions that occur after the balance sheet date but prior to the issuance of the financial statements to provide additional evidence for certain estimates or to identify matters that require additional disclosure. Subsequent events have been evaluated as required. The Company has evaluated all subsequent events and determined that there are no material recognized or unrecognized subsequent events requiring disclosure, other than as disclosed within the above notes to these consolidated financial statements, and except as described below.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;text-align:justify;background:#ffffff;margin:0pt;"><span style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">License Agreement</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;text-indent:36pt;background:#ffffff;margin:0pt;"><span style="white-space:pre-wrap;">On January 4, 2024, the Comapny entered into a license agreement and share issuance agreement with LG Chem, Ltd. (&#8220;LGC&#8221;).  Under the terms of the license agreement, the Company obtained worldwide rights to LGC&#8217;s proprietary compound LB54640 and will assume sponsorship of two ongoing LGC Phase 2 studies designed to evaluate safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics and weight loss efficacy of LB54640. </span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;text-indent:36pt;background:#ffffff;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;text-indent:36pt;background:#ffffff;margin:0pt;">At closing, we paid LGC $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_USD_ahrPfpXSU0iVPcR9ppfKnA" contextRef="As_Of_1_4_2024_srt_CounterpartyNameAxis_rytm_LGChemLtdMember_us-gaap_SubsequentEventTypeAxis_us-gaap_SubsequentEventMember_us-gaap_TypeOfArrangementAxis_rytm_LicenseAgreementAndShareIssuanceAgreementMember_G2wj2boCwUm5z8YAa9AxhA" decimals="-6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="rytm:CashPaymentMadeForLicenseAgreement" scale="6" id="Narr_rNhxQmCCq0yCuX4UpRzXSA">40</ix:nonFraction> million in cash and issued shares of our common stock with an aggregate value of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_USD_ahrPfpXSU0iVPcR9ppfKnA" contextRef="Duration_1_4_2024_To_1_4_2024_srt_CounterpartyNameAxis_rytm_LGChemLtdMember_us-gaap_SubsequentEventTypeAxis_us-gaap_SubsequentEventMember_us-gaap_TypeOfArrangementAxis_rytm_LicenseAgreementAndShareIssuanceAgreementMember_y0a-wARyAk-iRMaIiEn3Lg" decimals="-6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="rytm:StockIssuedDuringPeriodValueNewIssuesLicenseAgreement" scale="6" id="Narr_QWksMGlPGke2NGOsVlq8Vw">20</ix:nonFraction> million. The shares were issued at a per share price equal to the <ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_USD_ahrPfpXSU0iVPcR9ppfKnA" contextRef="As_Of_1_4_2024_srt_CounterpartyNameAxis_rytm_LGChemLtdMember_us-gaap_SubsequentEventTypeAxis_us-gaap_SubsequentEventMember_us-gaap_TypeOfArrangementAxis_rytm_LicenseAgreementAndShareIssuanceAgreementMember_G2wj2boCwUm5z8YAa9AxhA" decimals="0" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen" name="rytm:ThresholdPeriodForCalculatingWeightedAverageClosingPricePerShare" scale="0" id="Narr_kYO_D686TUq1Gf7dwqgRaQ">ten</ix:nonFraction><span style="white-space:pre-wrap;">-day volume weighted average closing price for our common stock, calculated as of the trading day immediately prior to January 4, 2024.  We also agreed to make a </span>$<ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_USD_ahrPfpXSU0iVPcR9ppfKnA" contextRef="As_Of_1_4_2024_srt_CounterpartyNameAxis_rytm_LGChemLtdMember_us-gaap_SubsequentEventTypeAxis_us-gaap_SubsequentEventMember_us-gaap_TypeOfArrangementAxis_rytm_LicenseAgreementAndShareIssuanceAgreementMember_G2wj2boCwUm5z8YAa9AxhA" decimals="-6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="rytm:LicenseAgreementConsiderationPaymentReceivedInCash" scale="6" id="Narr_95O4k2RVOUuRTmR5mMvm8w">40</ix:nonFraction> million payment in cash <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="Duration_1_4_2024_To_1_4_2024_srt_CounterpartyNameAxis_rytm_LGChemLtdMember_us-gaap_SubsequentEventTypeAxis_us-gaap_SubsequentEventMember_us-gaap_TypeOfArrangementAxis_rytm_LicenseAgreementAndShareIssuanceAgreementMember_y0a-wARyAk-iRMaIiEn3Lg" format="ixt-sec:durwordsen" name="rytm:LockUpPeriodForSubsequentCashPayment" id="Narr_iqwxJvoa7E-orEPyEEltgQ">18 months</ix:nonNumeric> after the effective date of the license agreement. </p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;background:#ffffff;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;text-indent:36pt;background:#ffffff;margin:0pt;">In addition, under the terms of the license agreement, we agreed to pay LGC up to $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="Unit_Standard_USD_ahrPfpXSU0iVPcR9ppfKnA" contextRef="Duration_1_4_2024_To_1_4_2024_srt_CounterpartyNameAxis_rytm_LGChemLtdMember_us-gaap_SubsequentEventTypeAxis_us-gaap_SubsequentEventMember_us-gaap_TypeOfArrangementAxis_rytm_LicenseAgreementAndShareIssuanceAgreementMember_y0a-wARyAk-iRMaIiEn3Lg" decimals="-6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" name="rytm:CashPaymentMadeForLicenseAgreementUponAchievingMilestones" scale="6" id="Narr_DoUFTsiAv0OQS0PUoEy0Yw">205</ix:nonFraction><span style="white-space:pre-wrap;"> million in cash upon achieving various regulatory and sales milestones based on net sales of LB54640.  In addition and subject to the completion of Phase 2 development of LB54640, the Company has agreed to pay LGC royalties of between low-to-mid single digit percent of net revenues from its MC4R portfolio, including LB54640, commencing in 2029 and dependent upon achievement of various regulatory and indication approvals, and subject to customary deductions and anti-stacking. Royalties may further increase to a low double digit percent royalty, though such royalty would only be applicable on net sales of LB54640 in a region if LB54640 is covered by a composition of matter or method of use patent controlled by LGC in such region and the Company&#8217;s MC4R portfolio is not covered by any composition of matter or method of use patents controlled by the Company in such region. Such increased rate would only apply on net sales of LB54640 for the limited remainder of the royalty term in the relevant region.</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12pt 0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p></ix:nonNumeric><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p></div><div style="clear:both;margin-bottom:30pt;width:100%;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Times','serif';font-size:10pt;text-align:center;margin:24pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;">F-35</p></div></div>
